    • onModProductSaveButtonClick

      public void onModProductSaveButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Save Button for saving User Data into the Product ArrayList. TextFields are checked for empty fields to avoid Runtime errors. On completion of checks and using the appropriate ArrayList return to the Main Screen. LOGICAL ERROR:
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - cause by the firing of a mouse click on the Save Button.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • preventNonNumericalDataEntry

      public void preventNonNumericalDataEntry(String fieldName, Class dataType, javafx.scene.control.TextField textFieldUsed)
      Method used to validate numerical data in the Inventory, Min, Max and Machine ID Integer TextFields, as well as the Double data for Price. FUTURE_ENHANCEMENT: Future revisions will eliminate the use of try/catch as it seem ineligant a solution. Future Revisions will instead use Regular Expressions. To help parse if a field has a number of character. Also Regex will also be able to detect Tabs and avoid the warning Pop-Ups.
      Parameters:
      fieldName - The name of the respective Textfield to be validated.
      dataType - The data type used to be validated.
      textFieldUsed - The respective Textfield used.

    • onModProductInvFieldKeyPress

      public void onModProductInvFieldKeyPress(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      Method used to insure ONLY Integer values in the Product Inv field. If a non-Integer/Number is entered a Pop-Up will warn user and clear field.
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - Unused in Method.

    • onModProductPriceKeyFieldPress

      public void onModProductPriceKeyFieldPress(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      Method used to insure ONLY Double values in the Product Price field. If a non-Double/Number is entered a Pop-Up will warn user and clear field. FUTURE-ENHANCEMENT: Use of a REGEX to validate would be much better than using try/catch, it would also eliminate odd behaviors during data entry.
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - s Unused in Method.

    • onPartRemoveAssociatedPart

      public void onPartRemoveAssociatedPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      User selected Part from the AssociatedPartTableView will then be "deleted" from only the AssociatePartTableView List and the userSelectedParts ArrayList defined at the top of the class. LOGICAL ERRORS: The original version of this Method did not delete the User selected Part from the userSelectedParts ArrayList, this caused all saves of the Modified Product to still retain the "removed" Part. The correction was to invoke a Remove method of the class to eliminate the offending Part.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - Unused by method

    • AddPartsSearchOnKeyPress

      public void AddPartsSearchOnKeyPress(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      Part Search will either take a Part Number or the Part Name, which will then be posted on the availablePartsTableView. LOGICAL ERROR: Similarly to the "mainFormController" Class, originally onKeyTyped was used to capture User Input. It would constantly trigger a Invalid Input Warning while typing. The correction was to attempt using a "Search Button", but required a second click from User in an empty Search Bar to "reset" the Table, that was not acceptable. The final correction used onKeyTyped. This resolved the Invalid Input Warnings while typing while maintaining the User expectation of Backspacing/Deleting the Search Textfield to restore the items in the Table View.
      Parameters:
      keyEvent - Used to get detect 'ENTER' Key Press to process Search. A second 'ENTER' Press in an empty field repopulates PartTableView.
